subject: Science
title: Ionic Bonds: Give and Take
description: A 60-second lesson on Ionic Bonds: Give and Take.

hook.text: Table salt exists because sodium desperately wants to give away an electron.

buildup.text: Sodium has one lonely outer electron. Chlorine needs one more to complete its shell.

discovery.text: Sodium gives its electron to chlorine. Now both have full shells and opposite charges.

twist.text: Opposite charges attract. They lock together in a crystal lattice ‚Äî that's a salt crystal.

climax.text: Ionic compounds dissolve in water because water molecules pry the ions apart.

punchline.text: Salt is just an atom that gave away an electron married to one that took it.

quiz.question: What holds sodium and chlorine together in salt?
